channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: One Strongman, One Billion Voters, and the Future of India
item.description: Narendra Modi has proved one of India’s most consequential leaders. But he has drawn criticism for anti-democratic practices and charges of religious persecution.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Biden’s Warning on Weapons Supplies Creates Outrage in Israel
item.description: Some in the Israeli government reacted with defiance to the president’s comments that the U.S. could withhold more weapons from Israel if it launched a major assault on crowded areas of southern Gaza.

item.title: Google employees grill Sundar Pichai and CFO Ruth Porat on why they're not getting pay rises amid blowout earnings
item.description: “Despite the company’s stellar performance and record earnings, many Googlers have not received meaningful compensation increases,” one top-rated question began.

item.title: Campus Protesters Are Demanding Colleges Divest From Israel. That Is Intellectually Impossible.
item.description: Colleges cannot accede to student protesters’ demands that they jettison investments because of the war in Gaza.

item.title: Nearly 79,000 Have Fled Rafah Since Monday, UN Says
item.description: Israeli forces had called for the evacuation of about 110,000 people from the eastern part of the Gazan city and seized the Gaza side of a border crossing with Egypt in an incursion this week.

item.title: AstraZeneca pulls its COVID-19 vaccine from European market after history of stumbles
item.description: Partial results from its first major trial — which Britain used to authorize the vaccine — were clouded by a manufacturing mistake that researchers didn’t immediately acknowledge.

item.title: What Kind of Husband Behaves Like Donald Trump?
item.description: Will the jury buy the image that the ex-president and his allies are selling?

item.title: Israel’s Shutdown of Al Jazeera Highlights Long-Running Tensions
item.description: The network will keep covering the war in Gaza, but it will be harder for Israelis to watch. Israel calls the network a security threat, while Al Jazeera says Israel wants to conceal its brutality.

item.title: Norwegian wealth fund CEO converts a century-old grain silo into a $46 million art display to promote tourism in his hometown
item.description: Once home to 15,000 tons of grain, Norges Bank CEO Nicolai Tangen's Kunstsilo is now a gallery of more than 5,000 artworks.

item.title: Stormy Daniels Faces Trump’s Lawyers, and Biden Blocks Weapons for Use in Rafah
10 Big Biden Environmental Rules, and What They Mean
item.description: Asbestos, “forever” chemicals, E.V.s and endangered species. Here’s what 10 new rules cover, and why the administration has been churning them out.

item.title: I'm a founder struggling with mental-health issues. How can I step away from my startup?
item.description: Bonobos and Pie founder Andy Dunn answers questions about how a founder can address mental health challenges, and how fast is too fast to grow.

item.title: Israel’s Shutdown of Al Jazeera Highlights Long-Running Tensions
item.description: The network will keep covering the war in Gaza, but it will be harder for Israelis to watch. Israel calls the network a security threat, while Al Jazeera says Israel wants to conceal its brutality.

item.title: A Former Guantánamo Prisoner’s New Life
item.description: In a quick but eventful year since his release, Majid Khan reunited with his wife, met his daughter who was born after his capture and added to his family with a baby son.

item.title: New York City’s watchdog investigates whether NYPD used official social media accounts to target public officials and private citizens
item.description: The Department of Investigation confirmed the probe, saying it was prompted by recent requests from City Council Speaker Adrienne Adams and the Legal Aid Society.
